page.title: 15QUERNMORE WATER PROJECT 3
page.content: In May 1984 a group of people from St.Michaels went to inspect the tunnel entrance at Abbeystead because they thought the water board was pumping too much water into the River Wyre,this was causing flooding further down river. While they were there there was a terrible explosion.Many people were killed or badly injured. After an enquiry they say the explosion was caused by methane gas coming from the rocks.They are spending one million pounds to repair the tunnel and to make sure nothing like this happens again.They are starting this work very soon.No more visitors will be allowed in but they can look at the pumping station from a fence a bit away.Everyone in the district was very sad when the disaster occurred.
